Row.Text: Hail new friend! Welcome to the realm of Norway. I am King Olaf, second of my name, the lord of this land.
God welcomes this meeting between us. I happen to be King Olaf of Norway. Come drink with me, new friend!
My longships will sleep eternal on the sea floor. My soldiers will rest eternal in Heaven. I only hope you spare my women and children if the mercy of God is in your heart.
Bah! I tire of this.
Get the deal overwith lest I raid your shores and do it on my own time.
God only knows why my warships have not yet pillaged your shores yet. Your being in my council is not appriciated.
My friend! Do you come with stories to share with a warm mug of mead under the blessings of god?
You again. I hope you have come here to beg for god's forgiveness for I have none.
Mighty heroes share my hall! Speak well to me of your achivements.
Your warriors rest upon my shores and hills - god looks down upon such aggression.
Think not that the wily works of merchants hold any will against my fleets of longship!
Let god disagree, yet I piss on your aggression.
Your settlers settle on Norwegian lands! In time and with god's blessing I will see them returned.
Bah! You have seen to it to make yourself a target of my raiding.
A truely impressive general you are my friend! Viking kings of old and God look upon your forces with approval.
Your vast wealth tempts many a raider, yet fear not my friend for we are in good times.
Yet another petty Jarl seeks to greaty with the favoured of God? Pathetic.
Have you so little men that can raise an ax or heft a spear? God is truely against you.
Sometimes victories number to many and other begin to be envious. I pray you see fit to stop your conquests and let your people rest should the world turn upon you.
I welcome all friends in my meadhall! But we have not known eachother long enough for me to truely see if you have found god in your heart.
See to it you find yourself in the pits of hell when this world bids you gone. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Even God spits on your misdoings. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
You fool. You only invite my warships and raiders into your supple lands.
You have found that {1_CivName} is a mighty friend indeed too! They feast in my halls with me and you should too!
A poor choice. God sees you have accepted {1_CivName} into your heart, this is no better than letting Lucifer.
Pray my axe does not find your skull soon. {1_CivName} deserves not your slander and is both honourable and pious.
Your take agrees with mine. A toast to {1_CivName}'s downfall!
I see you have invited {1_CivName} into your heart, and so have I. Come feast the three of us in my hall!
{1_CivName} is truely a vile and unholy menance that does the world harm. Your friendship with {1_CivName} is a league opposed to God.
Hah my friend! Should you join me on my longship we can pillage {1_CivName} together.
Together we shall feast, in friendship!
I will stand with you from this day till the day of judgement when we go unto Heaven.
Bah! Move your warriors or face mine in the field.
This is Norway, not whatever land inspired by hell itself that you come from. Defile no more of my territory.
Do you tempt my wrath? God will surely judge your theft of land.
Your cities sit on Norwegian land. Should another and both will be my cities on Norwegian land.
Do you have honour? Both the true God and those of the pagans see none.
Your heart is pure and virtuous. I thank you. Norway thanks you. God thanks as well.
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Attacking the City-State will greatly damage relations and may lead to war.
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
If you do not defend your lands well enough this is not my issue.
God sees your demand is just, I accept.
I believe I found this on foreign shores. Would you want some?
My adventurers seek to explore your mead halls, your many lands, and your beautiful women! Norway has many of the same, are you interested?
Only god knows.
Your cities will burn and your women will wail! Norway fights with the blessing of God.
Hah! Meet me on the field of battle alone and we shall settle this in a feat of heroism and valor.
If you wish we shall make this short, God pitties the nonpious warmonger.
I let you into my hall! I shared you my mead, my bread, and my God. Your undoing will be the darkness in your heart if not the steel of my axe.
I am not yet done. Your fields are not pillaged enough.
I agree not.
Yes! God sees that it will be.
